content.description: Start on slippery holds to find the balance to pull yourself out of the water.  After a few moves, traverse left a few feet, avoiding slippery holds, then hit a nice side pull before doing an awkward topout.
content.protection: 5 feet of water when you start 7 feet of water under you after traversing left.
content.location: Under the bridge, to the right.

content.description: Start with a left foot on the underwater boulder to your left, reach up to a good left hand sidepull, and find your way up and a bit to the right to top out.  Name is because I was on lunch break when I first found and climbed this problem.
content.location: Far left (east) end of the south wall before the water goes from deep to shallow.  Water is nice and deep (~8 feet) with a sandy bottom here.

content.description: The south rock wall along the river.
